summary: The document comprises payroll authorization forms and related documents for Jeffrey Facter, detailing his employment as Staff Counsel for the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA), including salary adjustments and leave entitlements. It also discusses the Assassination Records Review Board's partial postponement of certain records, citing historical interest and privacy concerns, with specific redactions of Social Security numbers. The document underscores the bureaucratic processes for staff appointment and salary adjustments, alongside the legal and ethical considerations in the employment of relatives under federal law.
key_findings: Jeffrey Facter served as Staff Counsel for the Select Committee on Assassinations with fluctuating salaries over his tenure.
Parts of the document were postponed by the Assassination Records Review Board for privacy reasons, including the redaction of Social Security numbers.
The document illustrates the review and release process for historical records, balancing public interest against privacy protections.
Payroll forms reveal the procedural steps for appointing committee staff and adjusting salaries, including adherence to federal laws preventing the employment of relatives.
